art_direction: Fragmented, poetic, and emotionally charged first-person narration set in an abandoned asylum. The horror focuses on cursed artifacts that are crystallized emotions, leading to graphic violence and dense, symbolic imagery.

scenes.title: The Iron Grin
scenes.text: The gate, a filigree of rust, grins at me. Pennhurst. The name tastes like static. In my palm, Grandfather’s Lens—a shard of impossible geometry—thrums with a cold pulse. A high, thin cry threads through the silence, a needle stitching the dead air. I have to go in. The silence demands a witness.

My hand is in the foreground, clutching a small, complex, crystalline object. scenes.title: A Paper Heartbeat
scenes.text: The lobby breathes dust. A cathedral of decay. Light bleeds from a high, dirty window, painting a wound on the checkered floor. A file, splayed open on the floor like a dissected bird. Its pages flutter in a phantom wind. My name is not on it. But I feel its pull. A paper heartbeat.

A single patient file lies open in a stark slash of light on the floor in the center of the room. My feet are visible at the bottom of the frame. scenes.title: The Glass Garden
scenes.text: I enter through the garden. Ruin in bloom. Weeds strangle statues, their stone faces screaming. But the flowers... they are not flowers. Crystalline growths, sharp-edged, catching the sick light. In the center of a patch of blood-red moss, a small, milky geode pulses with a soft, internal light. A memory, trapped in quartz.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person view of an overgrown asylum garden filled with strange, crystalline plant-like structures alongside normal weeds. In the center, a small, milky white geode rests on red moss, glowing faintly. My hand is reaching towards it. choices.text: Ignore it and find a way inside.

scenes.title: Elara's Echo
scenes.text: Patient 418. Elara. 'Prone to episodes of... transcendent joy.' The words blur. The room fractures. A girl, dancing in this very hall, her bare feet silent on the tiles. She turns to me, her face a porcelain mask of bliss, and then her mouth opens too wide, unhinging, and a thousand tiny, chitinous legs spill out. I recoil, the vision shattering into dust and silence.

A ghostly, superimposed image of a young woman's screaming face, mouth unnaturally wide, hovers over the page. scenes.title: The Doctor's Scrawl
scenes.text: Behind the desk, a leather-bound logbook. Grandfather’s handwriting. A frantic dance of ink. He wasn't healing them. He was harvesting. 'The emotional resonance is astounding... a psychic geode... The Conductor below amplifies everything.' Below. The basement. A deep thrumming resonates up through my soles.
scenes.image_prompt: Close-up, first-person view of my hands holding an old, cracked leather logbook. The handwriting on the page is frantic and barely legible, with diagrams of crystals and a large machine. scenes.title: A Moment's Peace
scenes.text: I touch the geode. Not pain. Sunlight on a closed eyelid. The taste of a fresh strawberry. A child's laugh. A pure, simple thing. But the light flares, a beacon. From the main building, a shriek rips through the air, a sound of torn metal and torn throats. It knows I am here. It is hungry.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person view, my fingers gently touching the glowing white geode on the moss. scenes.title: Heart of Rage
scenes.text: The infirmary is a gallery of rust. On a surgical tray, beneath a buzzing fluorescent tube, lies a geode of jagged, blood-red crystal. It pulses with heat. Rage. Pure, distilled. A memory of betrayal and a meat cleaver. The air thickens, vibrating with its fury. I can feel its edges in my own teeth.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person perspective inside a derelict infirmary. In the center of the frame, a rusted metal surgical tray holds a violently red, jagged crystal that seems to pulse. Rusted medical equipment is scattered around. scenes.title: Corridor of Weeping
scenes.text: An endless throat of a hallway. Cell doors gape on either side. A thick, black fluid, like tar or spoiled ink, weeps from the joints in the walls, tracing patterns of madness. The distant cries are closer now, a chorus of singular agonies. Each door is a mouth. Each one wants to tell me its story. To swallow me.

scenes.title: The Throat
scenes.text: A concrete stairwell. A maw leading down into absolute black. The air that rises is cold, smelling of ozone and old blood. The thrumming is a physical force now, a vibration in my bones, a second, alien heartbeat. Grandfather’s Conductor is down there. The engine of all this pain.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person view looking down a steep, dark concrete staircase into pitch-black darkness. A single, bare fluorescent bulb above me casts harsh shadows. My feet are on the top step. scenes.title: A Shard of Fury
scenes.text: I bring a metal stool down upon the red crystal. It does not shatter. It explodes. A wave of pure, psychic violence slams into me. My vision floods with red. The screams of a hundred murdered souls echo in my skull. I see through their eyes, feel the cleaver in my own hand. The rage is mine now. A beautiful, sharp clarity. In the psychic shriek, I hear the thing in the walls recoil.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person view, looking at the surgical tray. The red crystal has just exploded. scenes.title: Sleeping Murder
scenes.text: I creep past the tray. The rage-geode hums, its dreams seeping into my mind. I see a nurse’s throat opening like a flower, a fountain of crimson. I taste the iron. I feel the satisfaction. I back away, a cold sweat on my skin. The thought was not mine. But the pleasure was.

scenes.title: Heart of Hope
scenes.text: Cell 418. A child’s drawings on the wall. Suns with too many eyes. Under a loose floorboard, a small, smooth geode of pale, opalescent blue. Hope. Elara’s last defiant spark. I pick it up. It feels warm. It resonates with Grandfather’s Lens, and for a moment, the two crystals project a map of light on the wall—a map leading down, to the very heart of the machine.

It's held above an open cavity in the wooden floorboards. The crystal in my other hand projects a faint, complex pattern of light onto the grimy wall. choices.text: Follow the map to the Conductor.

scenes.title: The First Specimen
scenes.text: His office. Untouched. On the desk, a final entry, dated years after the asylum closed. 'It is a success. The Composite Psyche lives. But it is hungry. It has taken my voice, my will... but not my love. I am the cage. I am the first specimen.' He didn't flee. He became the warden of his own monster, a ghost in his own machine.

scenes.title: The Composite Psyche
scenes.text: The basement chamber is circular. At its heart, the Conductor: a brass and glass nightmare of humming coils. Fused to it is... the thing. A tumorous mass of crystalline flesh and weeping eyes, mouths opening and closing in a silent chorus. It is a living geode of pain. And from its depths, a single, familiar face surfaces, mouthing my name. Grandfather.

Fused to its side is a grotesque, pulsating mass of crystalline flesh embedded with dozens of eyes and mouths. A man's face is visible, trapped within the surface of the mass. choices.text: Use the Heart of Hope to overload the machine.
Use my own rage to tear it apart.
Surrender to the choir of voices.

scenes.title: The Shattered Choir
scenes.text: I press Elara's geode of Hope against my Grandfather's Lens. I aim it at the Conductor. Not an attack, but an offering. A single, pure note of joy in an ocean of pain. The machine screams, unable to process it. The Composite Psyche shudders, cracks, and then dissolves into a billion points of soft, blue light. The spirits, freed, rush past me, a wind of whispers and gratitude. I walk out of the silent asylum and into the clean, quiet dawn.
scenes.image_prompt: First-person view looking at the machine as it shatters into a cloud of blue light particles. My hands are in front of me, holding two crystals that are glowing intensely. The grotesque flesh-mass is gone. Light pours in from a high window. scenes.title: Another Voice
scenes.text: The rage is a fire in my veins. I scream, a sound of pure hate, and charge. I plunge a rusted pipe into the fleshy mass. It is like stabbing a mountain. The thing does not recoil. It absorbs. The rage is sucked from me, a delicious meal. Crystalline tendrils erupt from the mass, plunging into my flesh, my bones, my soul. My scream becomes one with the chorus. My eyes, another pair on the surface of the whole. I am home.

scenes.title: The New Host
scenes.text: I can't fight it. The voices. They promise an end to loneliness. A thousand lifetimes, a thousand minds, all one. I open my arms. I open my mind. The Composite Psyche pours into me, a flood of memories and pain and hunger. My body convulses, bones snapping and reforming. I stand up, but it is not 'I' who stands. We look at our new hands. We are so very hungry. We walk out of the asylum, into a world full of ripe, screaming emotions, ready for the harvest.
